intro: Adenonema cherleriae, commonly known as the Cherlera's adenonema, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Africa. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus and other aromatic plants. The plant is characterized by its simple, alternate leaves and clusters of small, white or yellowish flowers. It produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. Due to its limited distribution and specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and somewhat obscure species within its family.
